qas.question: Give two examples of spiritual gifts.

answers.text: speaking in tongues and divine healing

qas.question: What are other terms used to describe Pentecostalism?
Pentecostals liken their teachings to those of what age?
Pentecostals believe in baptism with what entity?
What three things are Pentecostals committed to?

answers.text: biblical authority, spiritual gifts, and the miraculous

context: This branch of Protestantism is distinguished by belief in the baptism with <a3_0>the Holy Spirit<a3_0/> as an experience separate from conversion that enables a Christian to live a Holy Spirit–filled and empowered life. This empowerment includes the use of spiritual gifts such as <a0_0>speaking in tongues and divine healing<a0_0/>—two other defining characteristics of Pentecostalism. Because of their commitment to <a4_0>biblical authority, spiritual gifts, and the miraculous<a4_0/>, Pentecostals tend to see their movement as reflecting the same kind of spiritual power and teachings that were found in the <a2_0>Apostolic<a2_0/> Age of the early church. For this reason, some Pentecostals also use the term <a1_0>Apostolic or Full Gospel<a1_0/> to describe their movement.
